arubaWiredRpvstMIB.name: arubaWiredRpvstMIB

revisions.description: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanId & arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanIndex mib objects are added to arubaWiredRpvstPortVlan table.
Initial version of this MIB module

arubaWiredRpvstMIB.contactinfo: Hewlett Packard Enterprise 3000 Hanover St. Palo Alto, CA 94304-1112
arubaWiredRpvstMIB.description: This MIB module for Rapid Per VLAN Spanning Tree(RPVST).

PointToPoint.name: PointToPoint
PointToPoint.description: forceTrue: This value indicates that the administrator requires the MAC to be treated as if it is connected to a point-to-point LAN segment, regardless of any indications to the contrary that are generated by the MAC entity. forceFalse: This value indicates that the administrator requires the MAC to be treated as if it is connected to a non-point-to-point LAN segment, regardless of any indications to the contrary that are generated by the MAC entity. auto: This value indicates that the administrator requires the point-to-point status of the MAC to be determined in accordance with the specific MAC procedures defined in 6.5.

arubaWiredRpvstResetCounters.name: arubaWiredRpvstResetCounters
arubaWiredRpvstResetCounters.description: Setting this object to true(1) will reset all the RPVST counters. Setting this to false(2) is no operation.

arubaWiredRpvstExtendedSystemID.name: arubaWiredRpvstExtendedSystemID
arubaWiredRpvstExtendedSystemID.description: Creates a unique bridge identifier for each VLAN by adding the VLAN ID (vid) value to the priority field of the bridge identifier in every RPVST BPDU. Indicates whether Extended System ID feature is enabled or not.

arubaWiredRpvstIgnorePVIDInconsistency.name: arubaWiredRpvstIgnorePVIDInconsistency
arubaWiredRpvstIgnorePVIDInconsistency.description: Setting this object to True(1) will enable RPVST to run on mismatched PVID links.Once set it will apply to all RPVST instances

arubaWiredRpvstPathCostMode.name: arubaWiredRpvstPathCostMode
arubaWiredRpvstPathCostMode.description: arubaWiredRpvstPathCostMode controls which pathcost mode to use. A device can function in one of the 3 modes defined below. pathCost8021d - The device calculates the default path cost for ports based on IEEE 802.1d. pathCost8021t - The device calculates the default path cost for ports based on IEEE 802.1t. proprietary -The device calculates the default path cost for ports based on the proprietary standard. Link Speed Vs Pathcost Table ---------------------------------------------------------- |Link speed| Pathcost in | Pathcost in | Pathcost in | | | IEEE802.1d | IEEE 802.1t | private standard| ---------------------------------------------------------- | 10 Mbps | 100 | 2,000,000 | 100 | ---------------------------------------------------------- | 100 Mbps | 10 | 200,000 | 19 | ---------------------------------------------------------- | 1000 Mbps| 4 | 20,000 | 4 | ---------------------------------------------------------- | 10 Gbps | 1 | 2,000 | 2 | ----------------------------------------------------------

arubaWiredRpvstVlanTable.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanTable
arubaWiredRpvstVlanTable.description: Information describing the RPVST configuration and statistics of the VLANs.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanEntry.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanEntry
arubaWiredRpvstVlanEntry.description: Information describing the RPVST configuration and statistics of each of the VLANs.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanId.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanId
arubaWiredRpvstVlanId.description: A VLAN ID to uniquely identify the entries.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanHelloTime.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanHelloTime
arubaWiredRpvstVlanHelloTime.description: The amount of time between the transmission of configuration BPDUs by this node on any port in this VLAN when it is root of the spanning tree, or trying to become so for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanForwardDelay.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanForwardDelay
arubaWiredRpvstVlanForwardDelay.description: The amount of time between transitioning from listening to learning and learning to forwarding by this node on any port when it is acting as a root for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanMaxAge.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanMaxAge
arubaWiredRpvstVlanMaxAge.description: The maximum age of RPVST information learned from the network on any port before it is discarded.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanPriority.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanPriority
arubaWiredRpvstVlanPriority.description: The value of the write-able portion of the Bridge ID (i.e., the first two octets of the (8 octet long) Bridge ID). The other (last) 6 octets of the Bridge ID are given by the value dot1dBridgeBaseAddress.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRoot.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRoot
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRoot.description: To explicitly configure this switch to be primary/secondary root for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRpvstAdminStatus.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRpvstAdminStatus
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRpvstAdminStatus.description: To enable/disable RPVST on the VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanResetCounters.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanResetCounters
arubaWiredRpvstVlanResetCounters.description: Setting this object to true(1) will reset the RPVST counters for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanOperHelloTime.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanOperHelloTime
arubaWiredRpvstVlanOperHelloTime.description: The amount of time between the transmission of BPDUs by this node on any port in this VLAN when it is root of the spanning tree, or trying to become so for this VLAN. This is the actual value that this bridge is using.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPriority.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPriority
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPriority.description: The priority of root bridge in this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPort.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPort
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPort.description: The root port for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPathCost.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPathCost
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootPathCost.description: The path cost to the Root from this bridge in this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootMacAddress.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootMacAddress
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootMacAddress.description: MAC address of the Root in this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootChangeCounter.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootChangeCounter
arubaWiredRpvstVlanRootChangeCounter.description: The number of times the root has changed for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanTimeSinceLastTopoChan.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanTimeSinceLastTopoChange
arubaWiredRpvstVlanTimeSinceLastTopoChan.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the last time a topology change was detected by the bridge entity for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanTopoChangeCount.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanTopoChangeCount
arubaWiredRpvstVlanTopoChangeCount.description: The total number of topology changes detected by this bridge in this VLAN since the management entity was last reset or initialized.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanSendTopoChangeCtrl.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanSendTopoChangeCtrl
arubaWiredRpvstVlanSendTopoChangeCtrl.description: Setting this object to true(1) will enable sending of SNMP notifications for all topology change events on this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanLogPortStateTransitio.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanLogPortStateTransitions
arubaWiredRpvstVlanLogPortStateTransitio.description: Setting this object to true(1) will enable event logging of PVST port state transitions for this VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstPortTable.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortTable
arubaWiredRpvstPortTable.description: Information describing the RPVST specific configuration and statistics of the ports.

arubaWiredRpvstPortEntry.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortEntry
arubaWiredRpvstPortEntry.description: Information describing the RPVST specific configuration and statistics of the ports.

arubaWiredRpvstPortAdminEdge.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortAdminEdge
arubaWiredRpvstPortAdminEdge.description: The administrative value of the Edge Port parameter. A value of true(1) indicates that this port should be assumed as an edge-port, and a value of false(2) indicates that this port should be assumed as a non-edge-port. Note that even when this object's value is true(1), the arubaWiredRpvstOperEdgePort can be false(2) if a BPDU has been received.

arubaWiredRpvstPortAutoEdge.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortAutoEdge
arubaWiredRpvstPortAutoEdge.description: It is used by the Bridge detection state machine for the automatic identification of edge ports.

arubaWiredRpvstPortBpduFiltering.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortBpduFiltering
arubaWiredRpvstPortBpduFiltering.description: This value indicates whether or not BPDUs need to be filtered on this port and BPDU filter option forces a port to always stay in the forwarding state and be excluded from standard STP operation. If the value is true(1) the received BPDUs will be dropped and no BPDUs will be transmitted on the port. If the value is false (2) the BPDUs will be processed as usual.

arubaWiredRpvstPortRestrictedTcn.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortRestrictedTcn
arubaWiredRpvstPortRestrictedTcn.description: This value indicates whether or not to propagate topology changes to other ports. true(1) causes the port not to propagate topology changes to other ports.

arubaWiredRpvstPortRootGuard.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortRootGuard
arubaWiredRpvstPortRootGuard.description: Setting this object to true(1) forces port to not to be selected as root port even if this port has the least path cost to the root.

arubaWiredRpvstPortLoopGuard.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortLoopGuard
arubaWiredRpvstPortLoopGuard.description: Setting this object to true(1) causes the non-designated port to go into the STP loop inconsistent state instead of the forwarding state. In the loop-inconsistent state, the port prevents data traffic through the link, therefore avoiding the loop creation. When BPDUs again are received on the inconsistent port, it resumes normal STP operation automatically.

arubaWiredRpvstPortBpduProtection.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortBpduProtection
arubaWiredRpvstPortBpduProtection.description: Setting this true (1) indicates that no BPDUs are expected to be received on this port. At the reception of BPDUs the BPDU protection mechanism will disable this port and port will transition into BPDU Error state.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanTable.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanTable
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanTable.description: Information describing the RPVST configuration and statistics of the ports in the given VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanEntry.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanEntry
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanEntry.description: Information describing the RPVST configuration and statistics of the ports in the given VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanId.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanId
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanId.description: A VLAN ID to uniquely identify the entries.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanPathCost.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanPathCost
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanPathCost.description: The contribution of this port to the path cost of paths towards the root which include this port. auto(0)

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanPriority.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanPriority
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanPriority.description: The value of the port priority field that is contained in the first (in network byte order) octet of the (2 octet long) Port ID.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanResetCounters.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanResetCounters
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanResetCounters.description: Setting this object to true(1) will reset the RPVST counters for this port-vlan pair. Get on this object will always return false(2)

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanRole.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanRole
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanRole.description: Role played by the port in a given VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanState.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanState
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanState.description: The port's current state. This state controls what action a port takes on reception of a frame.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanDesigBridge.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanDesigBridge
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanDesigBridge.description: The Bridge Identifier of the bridge that this port considers to be the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanOperPointToPoint.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanOperPointToPoint
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanOperPointToPoint.description: true : This value indicates that the MAC is connected to a point-to-point LAN segment; i.e., there is at most one other system attached to the LAN segment. false: This value indicates that the MAC is connected to a non-point-to-point LAN segment; i.e., there can be more than one other system attached to the LAN segment.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanOperEdge.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanOperEdge
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanOperEdge.description: The operational status of the edge port parameter. A value of true(1) indicates that this port should be assumed as an edge-port, and a value of false(2) indicates that this port should be assumed as a non-edge-port.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanInconsistencyReas.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanInconsistencyReason
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanInconsistencyReas.description: The reason for which port is blocked by spanning tree protection function.

arubaWiredRpvstNotificationTable.name: arubaWiredRpvstNotificationTable
arubaWiredRpvstNotificationTable.description: Information describing the Rpvst configuration and statistics of the Ports and Vlans.

arubaWiredRpvstNotificationEntry.name: arubaWiredRpvstNotificationEntry
arubaWiredRpvstNotificationEntry.description: Information describing the Rpvst events for trap generation.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanErrantBpduRxCount.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanErrantBpduRxCount
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanErrantBpduRxCount.description: The number of BPDUs received on a BPDU-filtering or BPDU-protected enabled port.

arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduSrcMac.name: arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduSrcMac
arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduSrcMac.description: The source MAC address of the port sending Errant BPDU.

arubaWiredRpvstSuperiorBpduSrcPort.name: arubaWiredRpvstSuperiorBpduSrcPort
arubaWiredRpvstSuperiorBpduSrcPort.description: The name of the port sending superior BPDU

arubaWiredRpvstSuperiorBpduSrcMac.name: arubaWiredRpvstSuperiorBpduSrcMac
arubaWiredRpvstSuperiorBpduSrcMac.description: The MacAddress of the port sending superior BPDU

arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduDetector.name: arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduDetector
arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduDetector.description: The identifier of the feature generating Errant BPDU trap.

arubaWiredRpvstPreviousRootBridgeID.name: arubaWiredRpvstPreviousRootBridgeID
arubaWiredRpvstPreviousRootBridgeID.description: Bridge ID of the previous Root. Bridge Id consists of priority and MAC address.

arubaWiredRpvstNewRootBridgeID.name: arubaWiredRpvstNewRootBridgeID
arubaWiredRpvstNewRootBridgeID.description: Bridge ID of the new Root. Bridge Id consists of priority and MAC address.

arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduReceived.name: arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduReceived
arubaWiredRpvstErrantBpduReceived.description: This Trap is generated when an unexpected (errant) BPDU has been received on a port.

arubaWiredRpvstNewRoot.name: arubaWiredRpvstNewRoot
arubaWiredRpvstNewRoot.description: Trap generated when sending agent has become the new root of spanning Tree for the specified VLAN; the notification is sent by a bridge soon after its election as the new root.

arubaWiredRpvstRootGuardInconsistency.name: arubaWiredRpvstRootGuardInconsistency
arubaWiredRpvstRootGuardInconsistency.description: Trap generated when a Root Guard feature enabled port receives superior BPDUs on its interface for a given instance.

arubaWiredRpvstLoopGuardInconsistency.name: arubaWiredRpvstLoopGuardInconsistency
arubaWiredRpvstLoopGuardInconsistency.description: Trap generated when a Loop Guard feature enabled port receives superior BPDUs on its interface for a given instance.

arubaWiredRpvstTopologyChange.name: arubaWiredRpvstTopologyChange
arubaWiredRpvstTopologyChange.description: Trap is generated when a Topology Change is detected in the specified VLAN.

arubaWiredRpvstNotificationCompliance.name: arubaWiredRpvstNotificationCompliance
arubaWiredRpvstNotificationCompliance.description: The compliance statement for Rpvst extension notifications.

arubaWiredRpvstGroup.name: arubaWiredRpvstGroup
arubaWiredRpvstGroup.description: These objects are used for managing/monitoring RPVST global parameters.

arubaWiredRpvstVlanGroup.name: arubaWiredRpvstVlanGroup
arubaWiredRpvstVlanGroup.description: These objects are used for managing/monitoring RPVST VLAN parameters.

arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanGroup.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanGroup
arubaWiredRpvstPortVlanGroup.description: These objects are used for managing/monitoring RPVST port parameters for the VLANs.

arubaWiredRpvstPortGroup.name: arubaWiredRpvstPortGroup
arubaWiredRpvstPortGroup.description: These objects are used for managing/monitoring RPVST port parameters

arubaWiredRpvstPvst1.name: arubaWiredRpvstPvst1
arubaWiredRpvstPvst1.description: Group of object added part of pvst1.

arubaWiredRpvstNotificationObjectGrp.name: arubaWiredRpvstNotificationObjectGrp
arubaWiredRpvstNotificationObjectGrp.description: Group of objects required for notifications.
